fields.description:
When CLC hostname is used in eucarc then "euca-describe-services" returns an error.  Other describe commands not impacted.

[~shaon] pointed out to try changing hostname to the IP and that was a valid workaround.

I ran into this same issue as well, with euca-describe-services and euca-describe-properties

*Cloud topology*

* 1 x CLC/Walrus/User Console
* 1 x CC/SC (Overlay)
* 1 x NC

*Eucalyptus package versions*
{code}
# rpm -qa | grep euca
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.4.2-0.0.548.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-walrus-3.4.2-0.0.548.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-console-3.4.2-0.0.1373.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-release-3.4-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-release-internal-3.4-1.el6.noarch
python-eucadmin-3.4.2-0.0.548.el6.noarch
euca2ools-3.0.2-0.0.120.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-cloud-3.4.2-0.0.548.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-enterprise-internal-release-3.4-1.el6.noarch
euca2ools-release-3.0-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-3.4.2-0.0.548.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-3.4.2-0.0.548.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.1.5-0.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-3.4.2-0.0.548.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-1.0.4-0.164.el6.x86_64
{code}

*Signs*

* With creds not sourced (euca-describe-services worked):
{code}
# euca-describe-properties
Unable to find credentials.
{code}
* With creds source (where DNS names are in eucarc after Eucalyptus DNS has been enabled):
{code}
# euca-describe-properties
/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/exception.py:100: DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6
  return self.message
Error(None):

# euca-describe-services
/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/exception.py:100: DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6
  return self.message
Error(None):
{code}

The admin tools are performing a substitution on {{EC2_URL}} to obtain the URLs for the admin services, but since the DNS name begins with "compute" the result is the compute service receiving requests that were intended for other services.
We should likely add another environment variable (and DNS support) for the administrative service host.

To address this issue DNS lookup for the properties and reporting services will be fixed (other admin services are already available). Currently reporting and properties services are not available in DNS:
